bioghist.p: The Order of the United Sons of America was founded in Philadelphia in the 1840s. It was the parent organization of the Junior Sons of America, which was later reorganized as the Patriotic Order of the Sons of America.

scopecontent.p: This is a book of minutes for the Order of the United Sons of America, Pennsylvania Camp No. 1. Entries document officer elections, visits to sick members, fines of members for absence from meetings or failure to submit reports, nomination and expulsion of members, and resolutions. The volume also includes a list of members.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
